lines.content: Grok is a desktop app for managing tasks and is optimized for use via the Command Line Interface.
1. Ensure you have Java `17` or above installed in your Computer.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for Grok.
4. Open a command terminal, cd into the folder you put the jar file in, and use the java -jar Grok.jar command to run the application.
5. Once you see the welcome message, you may begin entering commands. Refer to [features](#features) for full list of commands.
> - **Words in UPPER_CASE** are the parameters to be supplied by the user.
e.g. in `todo DESCRIPTION`, `DESCRIPTION` is a parameter which can be used as `todo read book`.
> - **Parameters must be input in the specified order.**
e.g. if the command specifies `/from START /to END`, `/to END /from START` will cause data inaccuracy.
> - **Extraneous parameters** for commands that do not take in parameters will be ignored.
e.g. if the command specifies `list 123`, it will be interpreted as `list`.
Displays all the tasks currently in the list of tasks.
Adds a todo task into the list of tasks.
Adds a deadline task into the list of tasks.
Adds a event task into the list of tasks.
Using the task's index, marks a task as completed.
Using the task's index, marks a task as incomplete.
Using the task's index, delete a task from the list of tasks.
Display all tasks that match a given keyword.
Task data is saved automatically to the hard disk when the application is exited. No manual saving is required.
Task data is saved as a CSV file at the designated file path. Advanced users can update data directly by editing that file.
| **List Tasks**        | Displays all the tasks in the list.                               | `list`                              | `list`                           |
| **Add Todo**          | Adds a todo task.                                                 | `todo DESCRIPTION`                  | `todo read book`                 |
| **Add Deadline**      | Adds a deadline task.                                             | `deadline DESCRIPTION /by DEADLINE` | `deadline read book /by Tuesday`|
| **Add Event**         | Adds an event task.                                               | `event DESCRIPTION /from START /to END`| `event read book /from 6pm /to 8pm` |
| **Mark Task as Done** | Marks a task as completed using its index.                        | `mark INDEX`                        | `mark 4`                         |
| **Unmark Task**       | Marks a task as incomplete using its index.                       | `unmark INDEX`                      | `unmark 4`                       |
| **Delete Task**       | Deletes a task using its index.                                   | `delete INDEX`                      | `delete 1`                       |
| **Find Task**         | Displays tasks matching a keyword.                                | `find KEYWORD`                      | `find book`                  |
Grok is a desktop app for managing tasks and is optimized for use via the Command Line Interface.
1. Ensure you have Java `17` or above installed in your Computer.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for Grok.
4. Open a command terminal, cd into the folder you put the jar file in, and use the java -jar Grok.jar command to run the application.
5. Once you see the welcome message, you may begin entering commands. Refer to [features](#features) for full list of commands.
> - **Words in UPPER_CASE** are the parameters to be supplied by the user.
e.g. in `todo DESCRIPTION`, `DESCRIPTION` is a parameter which can be used as `todo read book`.
> - **Parameters must be input in the specified order.**
e.g. if the command specifies `/from START /to END`, `/to END /from START` will cause data inaccuracy.
> - **Extraneous parameters** for commands that do not take in parameters will be ignored.
e.g. if the command specifies `list 123`, it will be interpreted as `list`.
Displays all the tasks currently in the list of tasks.
Adds a todo task into the list of tasks.
Adds a deadline task into the list of tasks.
Adds a event task into the list of tasks.
Using the task's index, marks a task as completed.
Using the task's index, marks a task as incomplete.
Using the task's index, delete a task from the list of tasks.
Display all tasks that match a given keyword.
Task data is saved automatically to the hard disk when the application is exited. No manual saving is required.
Task data is saved as a CSV file at the designated file path. Advanced users can update data directly by editing that file.
| **List Tasks**        | Displays all the tasks in the list.                               | `list`                              | `list`                           |
| **Add Todo**          | Adds a todo task.                                                 | `todo DESCRIPTION`                  | `todo read book`                 |
| **Add Deadline**      | Adds a deadline task.                                             | `deadline DESCRIPTION /by DEADLINE` | `deadline read book /by Tuesday`|
| **Add Event**         | Adds an event task.                                               | `event DESCRIPTION /from START /to END`| `event read book /from 6pm /to 8pm` |
| **Mark Task as Done** | Marks a task as completed using its index.                        | `mark INDEX`                        | `mark 4`                         |
| **Unmark Task**       | Marks a task as incomplete using its index.                       | `unmark INDEX`                      | `unmark 4`                       |
| **Delete Task**       | Deletes a task using its index.                                   | `delete INDEX`                      | `delete 1`                       |
| **Find Task**         | Displays tasks matching a keyword.                                | `find KEYWORD`                      | `find book`                  |
* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* It supports adding To-do, Deadline, and Event tasks.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified task type and details.
* @param taskType the type of the task (todo, deadline, or event).
* @param taskDetails the details of the task.
* Executes the AddCommand to add a task to the task list.
* @param tasks the TaskList to add the task to.
* @param ui the Ui to interact with the user.
* @param storage the Storage to save the task.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showError("Oh no, todo cannot be empty. Do something!");
ui.showError("Invalid deadline command. Please use: deadline <description> /by <date/time>");
ui.showError("Invalid event command. Please use: event <description> /from <start> /to <end>");
ui.showMsg("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.showMsg("Now you have " + tasks.size() + (tasks.size() == 1 ? " task" : " tasks") + " in the list.");
* Returns whether this command will terminate the program.
* @return false because AddCommand does not exit the program.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* This command allows the user to specify a task by its index for removal.
* Creates a DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to be deleted (1-based index, adjusted to 0-based internally).
this.taskIndex = taskIndex - 1;  // Convert 1-based index to 0-based index
* Executes the delete command, removing the specified task from the TaskList.
* @param tasks the TaskList from which the task will be deleted
* @param ui the user interface for displaying messages
* @param storage the storage system for saving task data
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showError("Invalid task index. Please provide a valid index.");
ui.showMsg("Now you have " + tasks.size() + (tasks.size() == 1 ? " task" : " tasks") + " in the list.");
* Indicates whether this command will terminate the program.
* @return false as the delete command does not terminate the program.
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* This command allows the user to terminate the program.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMsg("Bye. Hope to see you again soon! Keep Grokking :)");

* Represents a command to find and display tasks that match a specified entry.
* This command allows the user to search for tasks based on a keyword or phrase.

* Displays the matching tasks or a message if no matching tasks are found.
* @param tasks the TaskList to search through
* @param ui the user interface for displaying messages
* @param storage the Storage used to handle task persistence (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* @param ui the Ui used to display messages to the user.
* @param storage the Storage used to handle task persistence (not used in this command).

* This command allows the user to specify the task number of a task to mark it completed

* @param taskIndex The index of the task to be marked as done (1-based index).

* If an error occurs (e.g., invalid task index), it displays an error message.

* @param ui the ui used to display messages to the user.
* @param storage the Storage used to handle task persistence.

* Represents a task with a description and a completion status.
* Constructs a Task with the specified description.
* The task is initially not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon for the task.
* "X" indicates that the task is done, otherwise it returns a space " ".
* Checks if the task is done.
* @return True if the task is done, false otherwise.
* Marks the task as not done.

* @return The formatted string representing the task for file storage.

* Represents a list of tasks. Provides methods to add, remove, and access tasks,
* as well as search for tasks by keyword.
* Default constructor that initializes an empty list of tasks.
* Constructor that initializes the TaskList with a given list of tasks.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to initialize the TaskList with.
* Adds a new task to the TaskList.
* @param task The task to be added to the list.
* Deletes a task from the TaskList based on the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to be removed.
* @return The task that was removed from the list.
* Retrieves a task from the TaskList based on the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to be retrieved.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Returns the number of tasks in the TaskList.
* @return The number of tasks in the list.
* Returns the entire list of tasks.
* Finds tasks that match the given keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* @return A list of tasks that contain the keyword in their description.
private final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Displays the welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("Hello, I am Grok! Your favourite personal assistant for task tracking :)");
System.out.println("Here are the list of things I can do for you:");
System.out.println("1. Create a todo task eg. [todo read book]");
System.out.println("2. Create an event task eg. [event read book /from 2pm /to 4pm]");
System.out.println("3. Create a deadline task eg. [deadline read book /by 2pm]");
System.out.println("4. Type list to view your list of tasks");
System.out.println("5. Type either mark or unmark and the task number to indicate completion of task");
System.out.println("6. Type delete followed by the task number to remove a task from your list");
System.out.println("7. Type find followed by a word you've entered to see relevant tasks");
System.out.println("8. Type bye to let me exit and rest");
System.out.println("I will autosave your list when we part :)");
* Reads a command from the user input.
* @return The command input by the user.
* Displays a divider line to the user.
* Displays an error message to the user.
* @param message The error message to display.
* Displays a loading error message when there is an issue loading tasks.
* Displays a custom message to the user.
